Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Strontium Technology" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(July 2011)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* **Strontium Technology Pte Ltd** is a PC and [flash memory](/wiki/Flash_memory) manufacturing company, having its headquarters in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). Today, its operations span to varied territories across [Australia](/wiki/Australia), [Botswana](/wiki/Botswana), [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand), [South East Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia), [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia), [Africa](/wiki/Africa), [Middle East](/wiki/Middle_East), [Russia](/wiki/Russia), [India](/wiki/India), [US](/wiki/United_States), [Canada](/wiki/Canada) and [Latin America](/wiki/Latin_America). In total, the company maintains a strong market presence in over 35 countries. Strontium Technology serves an international network of distributors, resellers, retailers and OEM customers. ## History Strontium Technology was founded in 2002 by Mr. Vivian Singh and Mr. Anshuman Gupta, who started the operations in Singapore and gradually expanded to South East Asia, Indonesia, Australia, New Zealand, India and USA. It actively collaborates with [Hynix Semiconductor](/wiki/Hynix_Semiconductor), [Micron Technology](/wiki/Micron_Technology), [Samsung Electronics](/wiki/Samsung_Electronics) and [Toshiba Corporation](/wiki/Toshiba_Corporation), with many of their integrated circuits incorporated into Strontium-branded memory. ## Awards and recognition - 2010 - Singapore Top 50 - Official website This article about a technological corporation or company is a stub.
